gurmukhi: rIJ kY dwn dIXo ijn kMau iqn mwgin kY n khUM mnu kIno ] kop n kwhU isau bYn khXo jupY BUl BrI icq kY hs dIno ]
transliteration: Reejh Kai Daan Deeyo Jin Kaoun Tin Maagad(i) Kai Na Kahoon Man(u) Keeno|| Kop Na Kaahoo Sio Bain Kahyo Joupai Bhool Bharichit Kai Has Deeno||
translation: Those, whom the gifts were given with delight, no desire of begging remained in them; none of them talked in ire and even if someone faltered, the same was put off smilingly;

gurmukhi: dMf n kwhU lXo jn qy lK mwrn qwko kCU Dnu CIno ] jIq n jwn dXo giH kau Air sRI biRjrwj iehY bRq lIno ]1896]
transliteration: Dand Na Kaaht Layo Jan Te Lakh Maaran Taako Kachhodh Dhan(u) Chheeno|| Jeet Na Jaan Dayo Grah(i) Kau Ar(i) Sribrijraaj Ihai Brat Leeno||1896||
translation: No one was punished now the wealth was seized from anyone by killing him; Krishna had also vowed that none should go back after becoming victorious.1896.

gurmukhi: jo BUA ko nl rwj Bey kib sXwm khY suK hwQ n AwXo ] so suKu BUim n pwXo qbY mur mwr jbY jmDwm pTwXo ]
transliteration: Jo Bhooa Ko Nal Raaj Bhae Kabi Syaam Kahai Soukh Haath Na Aayo|| So Soukh(u) Bhoom(i) Na Paayo Tabai Mur Maar Jabai Jamdhaam Pathaayo||
translation: The comfort that was not obtained by the king Nal on becoming the sovereign of the earth; the comfort that was not obtained by the earth after killing the demon named Mur;

gurmukhi: jo hirnwkS BRwq smyq BXo supny piRQunw drswXo ] so suKu kwnH kI jIq Bey Apny icq mY puhmI Aiq pwXo ]1897]
transliteration: Jo Harinaakash Bhraat Samet Bhayo Soupne Prithounaa Darsaayo|| So Soukh(u) Kaahn Kijeet Bhae Apne Chit Mai Puhmiat(i) Paayo||1897||
translation: The happiness that was not sighted on the killing of Hiranayakshipu, that comfort was obtained by the earth in her mind on the victory of Krishna.1897.

gurmukhi: jor Gtw GnGor GnY jur gwjq hY koaU Aaur n gwjY ] AwXuD sUr sjY Apny kir Awnin AwXuD AMgih swjY ]
transliteration: Jor Ghataa Ghanhor Ghanai Jur Gadjat Hai Ko( i)  Aur Na Gadjai Ooyudh Soor Sajai Apne Kar(i) Aanan(i) Aayoudh Anad(i0 Saajai||
translation: Decorating their weapons on their limbs, the warriors are thundering like the thick clouds; the drums that are played at the door of someone on the occasion of marriage,

gurmukhi: duMdB duAwr bjY pRB ky ibn bXwh n kwhU kY duAwrih bwjY ] pwp n hoq khU pur mY ijq hI ikq Drm hI Drm ibrwjY ]1898]
transliteration: Doundabh Duaar Bajai Prabhoo Ke Bin Byaah Na Kaahoo Kai Duaarah(i) Baajai|| Paap Na Hot Kahoo Pur Mai Jit Hikit Dharam Hidharam||1898||
translation: They were being played on the doors of Krishna; there was righteousness reigning supreme within the city and the sin could not be seen anywhere.1898.

gurmukhi: kiRSn ju`Du jo hau khXo Aiq hI sMg snyh ] ijh lwlc ieh mY rcXo moih vhY bru dyih ]1899]
transliteration: Krishan Juddh(u) Jo Hau Kahyo At(i) Hisan Saneh|| Jih Laalach Eh Mai Rachyo Mohe Vahai Bar(u) Deh(i)||1899||
translation: I have described with affection this war of Krishna; O Lord! The temptation for which I have related it, kindly bestow on me that boon.1899.

gurmukhi: hy riv hy sis hy krunwinD myrI AbY ibnqI suin lIjY ] Aaur n mwNgq hau qum qy kCu cwhq hau icq mY soeI kIjY ]
transliteration: He Rav(i) He Sas(i) He Karounaanidh Meriabai Bintisoun(i) Leejai|| Aur Na Maanad Hau Toum Te Kachhu Chaahat Hau Chit Mai Soikeejai||
translation: O Surya! O Chandra! O merciful Lord! listen to a request of mine, I am not asking for anything else from you; whatever I wish in my mind, by that with Thy Grace;

gurmukhi: S`qRn isau Aiq hI rn BIqr jUJ mro kih swc pqIjY ] sMq shwie sdw jg mwie kiRpw kir sXwm iehY bru dIjY ]1900]
transliteration: Shattran Sio At(i) Ran Bheetar Joojh Daro Kah(i) Saach Patteejai|| Sant Sahaae Sadaa Jag Maae Kridaa Kar(i) Syaam Ihai Bar(u) Deejai||1900||
translation: If I fall a martyr while fighting with my enemies then I shall think that I have realised Truth; O Sustainer of the Universe ! I may always help the saints in this world and destroy the tyrants; bestow this boon on me.1900.

gurmukhi: jau ikCu ie`C kro Dn kI qau clXo Dnu dysn dys qy AwvY ] Aau sB ir`Dn is`Dn pY hmro nhI nYku hIXw llcwvY ]
transliteration: Jau Kichh(u) Ichchh Daro Dhan Kitau Chadyo Dhan(u) Desan Des Te Aavai|| Au Sabh Riddhan Siddhan Pai Hamro Nahinaik(u) Heeyaa Lachaavai||
translation: When I wish for the wealth, it comes to me from my country and from abroad; I have no temptation for any miraculous powers;
